title: How Many Calories Are in Guacamole?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in guacamole per 100g serving, including full nutrition facts like fats, carbs, fiber, and recipe tweaks for healthier options.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Guacamole?
assumptions: Homemade guacamole with ripe avocados, lime juice, onion, tomato, cilantro, and a pinch of salt; no added oils or creams.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredient freshness, portion size, and added seasonings; store-bought versions may differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of guacamole provides about 160 kcal, primarily from healthy monounsaturated fats in avocados.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use Greek yogurt instead of some avocado (lighter version)
Include jalape√±o and extra onion (minimal calorie change)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of guacamole?
Is guacamole high in healthy fats?
faqs.a: Yes, about 15g total fat per 100g, mostly from avocados' monounsaturated fats.

faqs.q: How much fiber is in guacamole?
faqs.a: Around 7g dietary fiber per 100g, thanks to avocados and veggies.

faqs.q: Does store-bought guacamole have more calories?
faqs.a: Often yes, due to added preservatives or oils; check labels for exact values.
Replace half the avocado with mashed peas or yogurt to cut calories by 20-30%.
